snippet: The weapons research center has been the target of sanctions because of intelligence suggesting that it was the training site for engineers who worked on chemical and biological weaponry.
abstract: American officials say Israeli attack on Syrian convoy of antiaircraft weapons appears to have damaged country's main research center for work on biological and chemical weapons.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, ERIC SCHMITT and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger and Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from Munich.

lead_paragraph: The weapons research center has been the target of sanctions because of intelligence suggesting that it was the training site for engineers who worked on chemical and biological weaponry.

headline.seo: Syrian Weapons Center Said to Be Damaged
headline.main: Israeli Strike Into Syria Said to Damage Research Site
headline.print_headline: Israelis May Have Damaged Syrian Weapons Center

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
